intro: Swertia fastigiata, commonly known as the upright swertia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of southern Asia. It belongs to the gentian family (Gentianaceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Swertia fastigiata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
